awd_titl_txt: Lee Cyclogenesis:  Its Role in Tropical Storm Development inthe Eastern Pacific
awd_abstract_narration: The initial location of tropical cyclones in the eastern                   Pacific Ocean indicates that the region just downstream of the                  mountain ridge in central Mexico is a favored location for                      tropical cyclogenesis.  A preliminary analysis suggests that                    flow interaction with the mountains of Mexico and Central                       America may be responsible for the generation of many of the                    initial disturbances which ultimately lead to the formation of                  tropical cyclones in the eastern Pacific.                                            The co-principal investigators will study the role of lee                  cyclogenesis in tropical cyclone development by employing a                     series of theoretical and numerical models of increasing                        complexity.  They also will attempt to corroborate the results                  of their numerical simulations by analyzing data for cyclone                    events in the region.  They hope to be able to identify                         upstream atmospheric flow configurations which are conducive to                 lee cyclogenesis which ultimately could lead to improved                        tropical cyclone forecasts in this region.
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
